page.title: 03ST. MARY'S CHURCH CLITHEROE
page.content: St. Mary Magdalene's Church has existed since 1128 A.D. The present building was built in 1828 but was restored after a fire in 1981. The bell tower of the church is at the west end. It has five floors and a spire. The bell tower has a ringing chamber and a bell chamber. There are eight bells which play a scale. Bell ringing is difficult and can also be dangerous so you have to be taught. When bells are rung there are different ways of ringing. There are rounds, peals and method ringing. The main church is a cross shape. The side chapel has a tomb for the alter. The East window is made of shields of local people or churches. In the graveyard are the old graves dating from the 1700's, the oldest belonging to Thomas Law.
